clinical_study.brief_title: Muscle Inflammation and Fat Infiltration in Patients Affected by FSHD
clinical_study.official_title: Muscle Inflammation and Fat Infiltration in Patients Affected by FSHD

brief_summary.textblock:
Facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD) is the second most common muscular dystrophy with approximately 500 patients in Denmark. It is characterized by weakness and wasting of the facial muscles, the muscles in the shoulder region and of the legs.
The primary aim of this study is to investigate possible links and order between inflammation and fat infiltration in the muscles in patients with FSHD.
Approximately 15 patients with FSHD will be recruited for repeated MRI-scans during a year where the inflammation and fat infiltration in the muscles can be quantified.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One MRI scan per subject (exam lasts approximately 60 min.)
primary_outcome.description: MRI (t2 mapping) will be used to quantify the inflammation in skeletal muscle.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One MRI scan per subject (exam lasts approximately 60 min.)
primary_outcome.description: The Dixon MRI will be used to quantify the fat fraction in skeletal muscle.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One muscle strength test per subject (exam lasts approximately 60 min.)
secondary_outcome.description: Isokinetic muscle dynamometry will be used to measure muscle strength.

arm_group.description: Patients over 18 years old with confirmed FSHD (facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy).

study_pop.textblock: Persons in Denmark diagnosed with FSHD is invited to the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed FSHD
Exclusion Criteria:
- All contraindications for undergoing an MRI scan
